title: Modified 2019 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 Coupe 3ZR ZTK
description: This 2019 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 coupe was purchased new in April 2018 and subsequently modified by Vengeance Racing of Cumming, Georgia. It was used in drag and road racing competitions, and an overhaul completed in 2022 included the replacement of the supercharged 6.2-liter LT5 V8, eight-speed automatic gearbox, and electronic limited-slip differential. Modifications include a ported supercharger and cylinder heads, a high-performance camshaft, revised engine tuning, Kooks long-tube headers, and an off-road X-pipe. Finished in Sebring Orange Tintcoat over Jet Black leather with orange stitching, the car also has Carbon Flash 19" and 20" 10-spoke wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a rear wing, power-adjustable GT bucket a back-up camera, navigation, a head-up display, and a Bose sound system. The seller purchased the car in 2023 and has since added approximately 500 of the 13k miles. This modified C7 ZR1 is now offered with a window sticker, the owner's manual, service records, spare parts, a car cover, and a clean Texas title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Modified 2019 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 Coupe 3ZR ZTK at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #174,607.
text: This 2019 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 coupe was purchased new in April 2018 and subsequently modified by Vengeance Racing of Cumming, Georgia. It was used in drag and road racing competitions, and an overhaul completed in 2022 included the replacement of the supercharged 6.2-liter LT5 V8, eight-speed automatic gearbox, and electronic limited-slip differential. Modifications include a ported supercharger and cylinder heads, a high-performance camshaft, revised engine tuning, Kooks long-tube headers, and an off-road X-pipe. Finished in Sebring Orange Tintcoat over Jet Black leather with orange stitching, the car also has Carbon Flash 19″ and 20″ 10-spoke wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a rear wing, power-adjustable GT bucket a back-up camera, navigation, a head-up display, and a Bose sound system. The seller purchased the car in 2023 and has since added approximately 500 of the 13k miles. This modified C7 ZR1 is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a car cover, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name. The ZR1 features a clear-coated carbon-fiber front splitter and rocker-panel extensions along with a vented carbon-fiber hood and exposed carbon fiber on the cooling vent surrounds and engine cover. This example is finished in Sebring Orange Tintcoat with matching ground effects trim and is equipped with the ZTK Track Performance Package, which adds front-splitter end caps and an adjustable high rear wing. Additional features include a removable carbon-fiber roof panel, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable mirrors, and a multi-mode exhaust system with quadruple outlets. Paint protection film and a Scrape Armor front splitter protector were added in 2022. Staggered-diameter Carbon Flash 19″ and 20″ 10-spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires measuring 285/30 up front and 335/25 out back. A corner-balanced suspension with spherical bearings on all four corners was added. Stopping power is provided by cross-drilled carbon-ceramic discs with red-finished Brembo calipers at each corner. The cockpit features power-adjustable GT bucket seats upholstered in Jet Black leather with orange stitching. Schroth racing harnesses, a Brey Krause harness bar, a hard-wired Uniden R7 radar detector, and a passenger seat base-mounted fire extinguisher were added. Additional interior features include front curb view cameras, a back-up camera, a head-up display, a Bose sound system, keyless entry and start, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation. The multifunction steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a 220-mph speedometer and a digital display with an integrated tachometer as well as gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, boost pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 13k miles, approximately 500 of which were added under current ownership. The replacement supercharged and intercooled 6.2-liter LT5 V8 was installed by Vengeance Racing in 2021 and is equipped with a ported supercharger, snout, and cylinder heads as well as a Nick Williams 112mm throttle body, a Vengeance Racing stage 2 camshaft, a Mighty Mouse catch can, and a Cordes Performance 5” cold air intake. The HP Tuners engine management system features E99, E85, and pump gas tunes. The exhaust system has been modified with Kooks long-tube headers and an off-road X-pipe. The eight-speed automatic gearbox and electronic limited-slip differential were replaced in December 2021. An aftermarket torque tube is fitted. [bat_carfax} The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. A framed poster depicting the history of the ZR1 with the car’s VIN is included in the sale. The window sticker shows initial delivery to MacMulkin Chevrolet Cadillac of Nashua, New Hampshire, and lists factory equipment and a total vehicle price of $146,905.
